title: Chinese Hackers Breached US Court Wiretap Systems: Report
content: Chinese hackers accessed the networks of US broadband providers and obtained information from systems the federal government uses for court-authorized wiretapping, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.
summary: Chinese hackers accessed the networks of US broadband providers and obtained information from systems the federal government uses for court-authorized wiretapping, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.

title: Flights From All Iran's Airports Cancelled Until Tomorrow Morning: Report
content: Flights from all Iran's airports will be cancelled until 6 a.m. local time (0230 GMT) on Monday from 9 p.m. on Sunday, Iran's state media said, citing a spokesperson for Iran's Civil Aviation Organisation.
summary: Flights from all Iran's airports will be cancelled until 6 a.m. local time (0230 GMT) on Monday from 9 p.m. on Sunday, Iran's state media said, citing a spokesperson for Iran's Civil Aviation Organisation.

title: Israel Deploys More Troops Near Gaza Ahead Of Oct 7 Attack Anniversary
content: The Israeli military said Sunday it deployed more troops to defend southern communities and areas bordering Gaza, ahead of the anniversary of the October 7 attack by Hamas.
summary: The Israeli military said Sunday it deployed more troops to defend southern communities and areas bordering Gaza, ahead of the anniversary of the October 7 attack by Hamas.

title: "Wouldn't Have Given Birth...": Gaza Mothers Struggle To Care For Newborns
content: Gazan mother Rana Salah cradles her one-month-old daughter Milana in her arms in a sweltering tent for the displaced, and speaks of the guilt she feels for bringing her child into a world of war and suffering.
summary: Gazan mother Rana Salah cradles her one-month-old daughter Milana in her arms in a sweltering tent for the displaced, and speaks of the guilt she feels for bringing her child into a world of war and suffering.

title: "Appreciate His Commitment To...": S Jaishankar Meets Maldives President
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday greeted Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu, who arrived in New Delhi for his first bilateral visit to India.
summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday greeted Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu, who arrived in New Delhi for his first bilateral visit to India.

title: Teen "Stabbed 50 Times" Then Burned Alive In France
content: "He was stabbed 50 times and taken to the Fonscolombes housing estate, where, according to the results of the autopsy, he was burned alive," said Bessone. His friend, also aged 15, was able to escape, Bessone added.
summary: "He was stabbed 50 times and taken to the Fonscolombes housing estate, where, according to the results of the autopsy, he was burned alive," said Bessone. His friend, also aged 15, was able to escape, Bessone added.

title: Long-Lost Part Of Earth Believed To Be 120-Million-Year-Old Found In Borneo
content: Researchers have reconstructed the ancient Pontus plate, estimating it covered an area roughly one-quarter the size of the Pacific Ocean.
summary: Researchers have reconstructed the ancient Pontus plate, estimating it covered an area roughly one-quarter the size of the Pacific Ocean.

title: "UN Like Old Company, Not Entirely Keeping Up With Market": S Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday took a critical view of the United Nations, saying it was "like an old company", not entirely keeping up with the market but occupying the space.
summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday took a critical view of the United Nations, saying it was "like an old company", not entirely keeping up with the market but occupying the space.

title: Rockets From Gaza Cross Into Israel Day Before Hamas Attack Anniversary
content: The Israeli military said that rockets fired from northern Gaza crossed into southern Israel on Sunday, a day ahead of the first anniversary of Hamas's October 7 attack.
summary: The Israeli military said that rockets fired from northern Gaza crossed into southern Israel on Sunday, a day ahead of the first anniversary of Hamas's October 7 attack.

title: Cop Dead, 10 Injured In Shooting Attack In Southern Israel: Cops
content: Israeli police on Sunday said a female border officer was killed in a shooting attack on a bus station that first responders say injured 10 others.
summary: Israeli police on Sunday said a female border officer was killed in a shooting attack on a bus station that first responders say injured 10 others.

title: EasyJet Flight Makes Emergency Landing After Passengers Brawl Mid-Air
content: Despite cabin crew and passengers' efforts to calm the situation, the disruptive man refused to comply.
summary: Despite cabin crew and passengers' efforts to calm the situation, the disruptive man refused to comply.

title: A Year Of Devastation And Tonnes Of Rubble To Deal With, Gaza's Struggle
content: The United Nations estimates there is over 42 million tonnes of debris, including both shattered edifices that are still standing and flattened buildings.
summary: The United Nations estimates there is over 42 million tonnes of debris, including both shattered edifices that are still standing and flattened buildings.

title: Israeli Airstrike On Mosque In Gaza Kills 26
content: The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza said on Sunday an Israeli strike on a mosque-turned-shelter in central Deir al-Balah killed 26 people, while Israel's military said it had targeted Hamas militants.
summary: The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza said on Sunday an Israeli strike on a mosque-turned-shelter in central Deir al-Balah killed 26 people, while Israel's military said it had targeted Hamas militants.

title: Three-decade Long Treasure Hunt For 'Golden Owl' Finally Over
content: A 31-year-long treasure hunt that attracted thousands of enthusiasts across France has come to an end.
summary: A 31-year-long treasure hunt that attracted thousands of enthusiasts across France has come to an end.

title: "I Promise...": UK Woman Writes Letter To Daughter Held By Hamas In Gaza
content: The mother of a British woman, who was among those taken hostage by Hamas on October 7, has written a heartfelt letter to her daughter and urged UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer to ensure it's delivered in Gaza.
summary: The mother of a British woman, who was among those taken hostage by Hamas on October 7, has written a heartfelt letter to her daughter and urged UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer to ensure it's delivered in Gaza.

title: This Singapore Hotel Has Been Named As World's New Best Skyscraper
content: Singapore's Pan Pacific Orchard hotel has been crowned the world's best new skyscraper, as recognised by The Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat (CTBUH).
summary: Singapore's Pan Pacific Orchard hotel has been crowned the world's best new skyscraper, as recognised by The Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat (CTBUH).

title: US Man Kills Wife, Dumps Body In Forest With Roommates' Help: Police
content: A 21-year-old man has been arrested and charged with the murder of his 20-year-old wife who disappeared from their home in Pendleton, South Carolina, on August 1.
summary: A 21-year-old man has been arrested and charged with the murder of his 20-year-old wife who disappeared from their home in Pendleton, South Carolina, on August 1.

title: 1,000-Year-Old Seed Revived In Israeli Desert, Grows Into 10-Foot Tree
content: The tree, linked to Biblical times, shows medicinal properties, including anti-cancer compounds.
summary: The tree, linked to Biblical times, shows medicinal properties, including anti-cancer compounds.

title: "True Hero": Dog Saves Injured Owner, 84, By Leading Cop To Her Home In US
content: The dog, named Gita, was first seen sitting in the middle of the road in a remote wooded area in Washington's Stevens County by a deputy.
summary: The dog, named Gita, was first seen sitting in the middle of the road in a remote wooded area in Washington's Stevens County by a deputy.

title: Inside Details Of How Israel's Mossad Worked Out Pager Idea: 5 Points
content: No Hezbollah operative suspected they were carrying Israeli-made bombs that were designed to ensure the user performs a two-handed procedure to access the pager's message before it exploded, The Washington Post has said in an exclusive story.
summary: No Hezbollah operative suspected they were carrying Israeli-made bombs that were designed to ensure the user performs a two-handed procedure to access the pager's message before it exploded, The Washington Post has said in an exclusive story.
